question.title: Issue with Microsoft Edge High DPI Settings and Selenium WebDriver
question.body:
Subject: Microsoft Edge with High DPI Settings Fails to Load Pages with Selenium WebDriver

I am a software engineer working in Japan and would like to report an issue with Microsoft Edge browser when used with Selenium WebDriver and High DPI settings.

Issue Description

When Microsoft Edge's High DPI setting is turned ON, Selenium WebDriver launches the browser but fails to load any pages. However, when the High DPI setting is turned OFF, everything works normally. This issue doesn't occur with Google Chrome browser with High DPI settings enabled.

・When I run the jar file with High DPI settings disabled for Microsoft Edge, the browser launches and displays the page correctly. ・When I enable High DPI settings (System) for Microsoft Edge and run the same jar file, the browser launches but no page is displayed. ・Google Chrome works correctly even with High DPI settings enabled.

Error Message

Exception in thread "main" org.openqa.selenium.SessionNotCreatedException: Could not start a new session. Response code 500. Message: session not created: probably user data directory is already in use, please specify a unique value for --user-data-dir argument, or don't use --user-data-dir
Host info: host: 'xxx', ip: 'xxx.xxx.xx.xxx'
Build info: version: '4.11.0', revision: '040bc5406b'
System info: os.name: 'Windows 10', os.arch: 'x86', os.version: '10.0', java.version: '1.8.0_202'
Driver info: org.openqa.selenium.edge.EdgeDriver
Command: [null, newSession {capabilities=[Capabilities {browserName: MicrosoftEdge, ms:edgeOptions: {args: [--remote-allow-origins=*], extensions: []}}]}]

Environment Details

  • Java: 1.8.0_202
  • Selenium: selenium-java 4.11.0
  • Microsoft Edge Driver: 136.0.3240.64
  • OS: Windows 11 (reported as Windows 10 in logs)
  • Microsoft Edge High DPI Setting: ON (Source: System)

Test Code

package selenium;

import org.openqa.selenium.By;
import org.openqa.selenium.WebElement;
import org.openqa.selenium.edge.EdgeDriver;

public class EdgeDriverSample {

    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
        
        System.setProperty("webdriver.edge.driver", "C:/tools/msedgedriver.exe");
        EdgeDriver driver = new EdgeDriver();

        try {
            driver.navigate().to("https://bing.com");
            System.out.println(System.getProperty("webdriver.edge.driver"));
            WebElement element = driver.findElement(By.id("sb_form_q"));
            element.sendKeys("WebDriver");
            element.submit();

            Thread.sleep(5000);
        } finally {
            driver.quit();
        }
    }
}

Questions

  1. Could this be a compatibility issue between Selenium 4.11.0 and Microsoft Edge with High DPI settings enabled?
  2. Is there a way to make Selenium work with Microsoft Edge when High DPI settings are ON?
  3. Are there any specific EdgeOptions or command-line arguments that could resolve this issue?

Requirements

  • We need to continue using Java 8
  • Microsoft Edge High DPI settings must remain ON (Source: System)

I have tried killing all Edge processes before running the test and have confirmed that the issue is specifically related to the High DPI settings.

Supplement

To configure High DPI settings for Microsoft Edge (or any other app), follow these steps:

  1. Right-click the desktop shortcut for Microsoft Edge and select "Properties".
  2. Go to the "Compatibility" tab.
  3. Click on "Change high DPI settings".
  4. In the window that appears:
  • Under "High DPI scaling override", check the box "Override high DPI scaling behavior."
  • For "Scaling performed by:", select "System" from the dropdown.

This helps resolve any blurriness or scaling issues on high-resolution displays.

Here is a screenshot of the settings in Japanese (for reference), but the steps above reflect the equivalent English version.

Screenshot of the High DPI settings dialog in Japanese Windows
